page.title: 07Noisy Sports in Bletchley
page.content: The Noisy Sports Area is next to the Milton Keynes Bowl.It is a motorbike track but is also used by B.M.X. bikes. It is a very bumpy track with ditches that have been specially dug out for the trials bikes.The ditches have vertical drops down the side. There are a lot of big hills which get very dangerous when it rains.There are trials events where a course is set and the bikes are given faults if they make mistakes,they are timed and the fastest time with the least faults wins the trial. To be safe on a B.M.X. you need a helmet,knee and arm pads,mouth trap(if you've got an open face helmet),glove pads and a safe bike or you won't be able to race.
